title: Jinan
summary: Jinan[1] (simplified Chinese: 济南; traditional Chinese: 濟南; pinyin: Jǐnán), alternately romanized as Tsinan,[lower-alpha 1] is the capital of Shandong province in Eastern China.[3] With a population of 9.2 million (including Laiwu), it is the second-largest city in Shandong after Qingdao. The area of present-day Jinan has played an important role in the history of the region from the earliest beginnings of civilization and has evolved into a major national administrative, economic, and transportation hub.[4] The city has held sub-provincial administrative status since 1994.[4][5] Jinan is often called the "Spring City" for its famous 72 artesian springs.[6]
